thread.title: South Sudan army leaves Juba as peace agreement calls for
thread.title_full: South Sudan army leaves Juba as peace agreement calls for | News24

author: news24.com
title: South Sudan army leaves Juba as peace agreement calls for
text:
Juba - South Sudan's army is moving its forces out of the country's capital, in accordance with a peace agreement signed with rebel forces aimed at ending a conflict that erupted in December 2013, an army commander said.
Under the peace agreement signed by President Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar in August, the capital, Juba, and some other centres will be demilitarised.
Shifting the army, the SPLA, out of Juba marks a step towards implementing the agreement, although both sides have been accused by international mediators of violating a permanent ceasefire that was put in place after the pact was signed.
Major General Marial Chanuong Yol Mangok, who is commander of Kiir's presidential guard, told reporters on Thursday that the redeployment of the army outside Juba had started. The shift will be completed when the army establishes camps for the troops in other parts of the country.
